concept.title: Case 5: Family share plan with capping

section.title: Overview
section.p: There is a family group with a single level of hierarchy associated with all family members (or devices) as shown in the following figure:

The family group has a monthly shared plan of 50 GB data, and unlimited SMS and MMS services. Each member of the family group (son and daughter) has access to the bundle. A usage limit of 10 GB is applied to each of the family member. A notification is sent when 9 GB of data is consumed from the group bundle. Each member (son and daughter) can query the group consumption.
As the family data bundle has unlimited access to SMS and MMS calls, no charges are applied to the bundle for SMS and MMS calls by any family member.

ul.li: Create a family group with a single level of hierarchy and associate it with family members.
Create a bundle with 50 GB of data and unlimited access to SMS and MMS calls, and associate to the family group.
Apply a cap on 50 GB of data to limit the consumption of resources.
Execute either a data, or an SMS or MMS call from any of the devices of the family members.

Verify that the SMS or MMS usage should not be charged, and for data, family members should not be allowed to consume more than the usage limit and notification is sent to them when they are reaching maximum usage limit.
Verify the reporting counters for each family member to track their group consumption are incremented properly for data, SMS, or MMS.

section.title: Provisioning

note.p: Ensure that after creating a record, you distribute it to ME. Otherwise, the provisioning will not be successful.

section.p:
Following entities are required for this use case. Entities for case 5
Entity Task
Notification preference Select the notification channel as email.
Notification templates Create a notification template and add the text to be sent to the end user in an email notification.
Notification servers Configure a notification server to send an Email notification.
Thresholds Create a threshold profile group to send notification when the consumption is nearing the cap limit defined. For example, 9 GB for the current case.
Cap Create a cap to limit the consumption of data bundle to 10 GB.
Charging services Create the personal and family charging services.
Lifecycles Create the lifecycles for family, personal, group accounts and bundles.
Bundles Create the personal and family data bundles. Associate 50 GB data bucket to family data bundle.
Users Create a user (FamilyAdmin).
Accounts Create the personal and family accounts.
Devices Create the devices for family members. For example, father, mother, son, daughter and associate personal bundle to these devices.
Groups Create a group and associate devices and 50 GB data bundle.
Counters
Create the Family group counter to track the usage of the resources at group level.
Note: The existing hierarchy counter to track the data usage, self-bucket counter to track the SMS usage, and self-CS counter to track the MMS usage are updated.
Provision the following data from SM GUI:

ol.li:
Create a notification preference following the given steps:
Navigate to Notification Management and select the Notification Preferences tab. Click to create the notification preference.
Set the notification type and frequency as follows:
Create a notification template. To do this, navigate to Notification Management and select the Notification Templates tab. Click to create a notification template and add the basic details.

Configure a notification server following the given steps:
Navigate to Notification Management and select the Notification Servers tab. Browse to select the Email from drop-down list as shown in the following figure.
Click to create a notification server as shown in the following figure:
Click to distribute the notification profile to the specific ME further selected for the iPhone.

Create a threshold profile following the given steps:
Navigate to Policy & Charging Configuration and select Common tab. Browse to select Thresholds from the drop-down list.
Click to create the threshold profile group. Associate absolute start threshold profile as shown in this following figure:

Create a cap entity following the given steps:
Navigate to Policy & Charging Configuration and select Common tab. Browse to select Cap from the drop-down list.
Click to create a cap Capping_Counter_10GB with GByte unit type and value 10 (a quota limit of 10 GB applied to the data bundle). Associate the following action to the cap entity as shown in the following figure:

Create a charging service following the given steps:
Navigate to Policy & Charging Configuration and select Charging tab. Browse to select Charging Services from the drop-down list.
Click to create a charging service and associate a family group bucket as shown in the following figure:
Associate with a 50 GB data bucket and configure the tariff formula as shown in the following figure:

Navigate to Policy & Charging Configuration and select the Common tab. Browse to select Lifecycles from the drop-down list. Click to create a lifecycle.
Following table lists the lifecycles required for this use case.
Lifecycle Applicable To
Create an account lifecycle (FamilyAccountLifeCycle) with Disconnected, Active, Dormant, ActiveWarned, Expired states. Select Object Status Lifecycle for Type and Account for Applicable to parameters. Family account
Create an account lifecycle (AccountLC) with Disconnected, Active, Dormant, ActiveWarned, Expired states. Select Object Status Lifecycle for Type and Account for Applicable to parameters. Personal account
Create a group lifecycle (GroupLifeCycle) with Active, Disconnected, PreActive, Inactive states. Select Object Status Lifecycle for Type and Group for Applicable to parameters. Group account
Create a subscription lifecycle (MonthlySubscLC) with Active, Disconnected, PreActive, Inactive states. Select Object Status Lifecycle for Type and Subscription for Applicable to parameters. Bundle
Create a data bundle of 50 GB named Family_Group_50_GB_Data_Pack for the FAMILY group.
Create a personal bundle named Personal_Bundle as per the following data and associate devices to this bundle.
Create a user FamilyAdmin to use as family administrator.

Create a personal account (PersonalAccount) following the given steps:
Navigate to Subscriber Manager and select ACCOUNTS tab.
Click to create a personal account and associate it with AccountLC lifecycle.

Create a family account (NokiaFamilyAccount) following the given steps:
Navigate to Subscriber Manager and select ACCOUNTS tab.
Click to create a family account and associate it with FamilyAccountLifeCycle.

Create devices (father, mother, son, and daughter) and make the following associations:
Since the subscription index has the value Group_First, the group resources are consumed first before the device resource consumption.
Entity Parameter Value
Device Name Father
Identifier Type IMSI
Identifier 123458888888801
Notification Profile NotificationProfile
Entity Name DeviceLifeCycle
Entity State PreActive
Subscription Index Group_First
Groups NokiaFamilyGroup
Category List DefaultCategory
Bundle Name Personal_Bundle
Account Name PersonalAccount
Note: Create the device records for father, mother, son, and daughter using the values in the preceding table. Note that only the Identifier value is different for each device. For example, 123458888888801 for Father, 123458888888802 for Son, 123458888888803 for Daughter, 123458888888804 for Mother.

Create a family group (NokiaFamilyGroup) following the given steps:
Navigate to Subscriber Manager and select Groups tab.
Click to create a family group. Associate the family group members to the group as shown in the following figure:

Create the family group counter by navigating to Policy & Charging Configuration and select Common tab. Browse to select Counters from the drop-down list. Click to create a counter and enter counter details.

Note that a predefined set of reporting counters (Hierarchy counter, Self bucket counter, Self CS counter) are available for operators in the system. The predefined set of reporting counters do not have applicability conditions and all the reports are of byte type. Hence, to count the data, SMS, MMS consumption done from group resources, you must update the existing reporting counters following the given steps:
Edit a hierarchy counter following the given steps:
Navigate to Policy & Charging Configuration and select Common. Browse to Counters from the drop-down list.
Click the edit button to modify the hierarchy counter as shown in the following figure:

Edit a self-bucket counter following the given steps:
Navigate to Policy & Charging Configuration and select Common. Browse to Counters from the drop-down list.
Click the edit button to modify the self bucket counter as shown in the following figure:

Edit a self-CS counter following the given steps:
Navigate to Policy & Charging Configuration and select Common. Browse to Counters from the drop-down list.
Click the edit button to modify the self CS counter as shown in the following figure:

To add Device Group Counter, navigate to Groups and search for NokiaFamilyGroup. Click the highlighted button on the right hand side to add counters as shown in the following figure:
The Add/Remove Counter window appears. Select Device Group Counter and Add Counter, and select Family Group Counter created in the preceding step. Click Save to create device group counter for all devices - Father, Mother, Son, Daughter.
Note: Each member of the group can consume resources from family group till 10 GB capping limit. Notification is sent at 9 GB consumption. Hence, in this case, Device Group Counter is added to all the devices.

To activate the device group report counters, navigate to Subscriber Manager and select Groups. Search the group using the group name (NokiaFamilyGroup). Click against the family group counter. Select the Device Group Counter in the Report Activation window.
Use the right arrow icon to move the reporting counter under the Activated Report section for all the reporting counters. Click ACTIVATE/DEACTIVATE REPORT button as shown in the following figure.
Note: Use the same step to activate group reporting counters for the group NokiaFamilyAccount by selecting the Group Counter option.
